title: Victims win fight for review of interest rate swaps compensation
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Victims win fight for review of interest rate swaps compensation Bully Banks has led protests against the banks’ conduct Bully Banks has led protests against the banks’ conduct James Hurley Enterprise Editor Published 31 minutes ago 
The City regulator has bowed to political pressure and agreed to review whether its compensation scheme for the mis-selling of complex financial products has failed victims. 
The Financial Conduct Authority said that it was willing to investigate whether there had been “systemic failures” in how redress was given to small and medium-sized companies mis-sold interest rate swaps by high street banks. 
Victims of the scandal, many of whom saw their businesses destroyed by the costly products, have complained that alleged failures in the compensation process allowed banks to apply undue influence. Criticisms include companies being excluded from the scheme entirely Subscribe now
